inventory.commentary: 18Jun08 - modified sense definitions, added features, examples. ahouston

sense.name: the legal state of owing money
sense.commentary: DEBT[+event][+state][+legal][+owing][+money] Note: usually in the phrases 'in debt' 'out of debt'
sense.examples: He went deeply in debt to buy that house. It took George fifty years to get out of debt. The corporation is heavily in debt and may file for bankruptcy.

sense.name: amount of money owed
sense.commentary: DEBT[+quantity][+money][+owed] Note: can occur in the plural (unlike Sense 1)
sense.examples: Their national debt has exceeded ten billion dollars. She's managed to pay off her debts a little each month. (the amounts owed) He lay awake at night thinking about his mounting debts to the mob. They are proposing a new approach to pay off the Third World debt.

sense.name: feeling of gratitude or thanks
sense.examples: We owe them a debt of thanks for their hard work on this event. He felt a debt to his parents for all the sacrifices they had made for him.
